A responsible voter does their research üßê  Already trying to figure out who you‚Äôll be including in your #Halalan2022 ballot? Here‚Äôs one of the things we need to consider: Are they for or against historical revisionism?  Comment below if you agree üëá  Art by @pammiina #preenph #NeverAgain #NoToHistoricalRevisionism

Today, we commemorate the 49th anniversary of the declaration of Martial Law in the Philippines under the dictatorship of Ferdinand Marcos. As we look back on the events of the past, we memorialize the foundation of his New Society‚Äîthe invocation of war, the abuse of power, the civil disorder, the corruption in the system, and the cries of seeking justice.  The Crusader Publication, in accordance with its pursuit of truth, condemns the atrocities and lies of the Marcos administration. We should not move on from the accounts of history nor be misguided by the tricks of historical revisionism. The darkest chapter in history allowed him to keep his hands clean while the military power he manipulated were tainted with the blood of the innocent.  May we heed the call to vote wisely in the upcoming #Halalan2022. Never Forget. Never Again.  #NeverForget #NeverAgain #MarcosNotAHero

SPEAK UP, CASA! Wave 2  175 days before the May 9, 2022, National Elections.  Recently, UST-CASA has collected 612 survey responses from the CASAN Community regarding Voters‚Äô registration: 99.3 % are aged 18 years old above, 0.5 % are 17 years old below, and 0.2 % are turning 18 before the elections; 88.9 % are registered voters and 11.1 % are not. In line with this, the data showed 99.6 % of the respondents intend to vote this May 2022, while 0.4 % do not. We would like to express our appreciation to everyone who participated.  Now that voter registration has ended, according to the Commission on Elections, young Filipino voters, who now account for 52 percent of all registered voters, could make a difference in next year's national elections. Together, we can make a difference.  SPEAK UP and vote wisely for the 2022 National Elections.  #Halalan2022 #EmpowerThroughCasa  Copy by Isaac Galvez Board by Ace Abella  RSO-A1-21-22-57

HALALAN 2022: ONE OF THE COURT‚ÄôS OPINION ON SUBSTITUION OF CANDIDATES  The Supreme Court‚Äôs opinion regarding substitution of candidates is discussed in the case of Federico v. Comelec, G.R. No. 199612 (2013) where it held that: ‚ÄúUnlike death or disqualification, withdrawal is voluntary. Generally, a candidate has sufficient time to ponder on his candidacy and to withdraw while the printing has not yet started. If a candidate withdraws after the printing, the name of the substitute candidate can no longer be accommodated in the ballot and a vote for the substitute will just be wasted.‚Äù  .  .  .  #lawyersnearmeph #lawyersnearme #lawyernearme #lawyernearmeph #legaladvice #legalconsultation #onlineconsultation #legaladvice #onlineconsult #onlineadvice #onlinelegalconsultation #legaladviceonline #attorney #attorneys #lawyer #COMELEC #substitutionofcandidate #election #electionlaw #candidates #electionlaws #candidate #substitutionofcandidates #Halalan2022 #Election2022 #duterte #du30 #saraduterte #saradutertecarpio #DuterteLegacy  Photo from pna.gov

Here‚Äôs a quick follow up post to last week‚Äôs about talking to children about the elections season here in the Philippines.  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never too early to talk to your child about politics. Kids live in a connected world and are constantly interfacing with political messages, so discussing politics with them is a way to engage authentically. These conversations are also a great way to let them know the value system you use to critically engage the world.‚Äù - Hoyt Phillips  We are sharing some great picture books about voting and democracy in our stories!  What are some books on this topic that you‚Äôve read with your young ones?  Have you talked to your little one about the elections or candidates? How did it go?  Share with us below!

DEADLINE OF WITHDRAWALS & SUBSTITUTIONS OF COCs  The Comelec Main Office in Manila is now opened to accept petitions for withdrawals and substitutions of aspirants for national positions in #Halalan2022.  The Commission on Elections (Comelec) has set the deadline of substitutions and withdrawals of candidacies from political parties for the 2022 elections on Monday, November 15.  They are expected to face an ‚Äúunprecedented‚Äù number of withdrawals and substitutions among aspirants for national positions.  All eyes are on the Commission on Elections (Comelec) offices as the nation anticipates which candidates will be withdrawing their bids and who will be substituting them. All we can do is wait and see who is officially in or out the 2022 elections until the Nov. 15 deadline.  Let us be wary of any attempt to abuse or take advantage of the rule on substitutions as a a political strategy for the elections. Our country does not deserve leaders who will neglect the integrity of the elections.  #PiliPinas #ParaSaBayan

Check out the total number of COC filers for #Halalan2022!  77 national positions are now up for grabs in the coming 2022 Philippine Elections. 1 president, 1 vice president, 12 senators, and 63 party-list representatives will officially be elected by the nation at large.  A total of 572 certificates of candidacy (COC) were filed for national positions by aspirants who officially made their bids from October 1 to 8, according to the Commission on Elections (Comelec).  97 Presidential aspirants filed their certificates of candidacy for the highest position in the land. Meanwhile, 29 Vice presidential aspirants filed their COCs for the second highest position in the land. A total of 176 Senatorial aspirants are vying for the 12 seats in the Senate. And 270 Party-list groups submitted the names of their nominees during the filing.  Candidates from political parties may still withdraw or substitute their candidacies until Monday, November 15. Let‚Äôs wait and see for the final number and list of candidates this elections.  Let us be reminded to choose our leaders wisely, based on track record, work ethics, and principles. Our country deserves better.  Makialam. Makibahagi. Magkaisa.  #PiliPinas #ParaSaBayan

Our differences shouldn't divide us.  Huwag natin hayaan na ang pagkakaiba sa opinyong politikal ang tumapos nang ating mga relasyon sa pamilya at kaibigan.  Kapag politika ang pinaguusapan, lalo na ngayong #Halalan2022, talagang merong iba't ibang opinyon at iba't ibang panindigan. Sometimes, those opinions that differ are from your family and circle of friends. So paano na, right?  Episode 4 of Lex Dei Podcast offers tips (no tricks!) on how you can approach this conversation. Our Youth Leaders, Rap Oronce & Martha Estrada, discuss with Author and World-Class Meta-Coach Aldem Salva√±a.
